skill.name: graphite-cli
skill.description: This skill should be used to answer questions and guide workflows related to the Graphite CLI. It assists with creating, managing, submitting, and synchronizing stacked code changes (diffs).
skill.summary: This skill should be used to answer questions and guide workflows related to the Graphite CLI. It as...
skill.author: Calel33

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only static markdown documentation about the Graphite CLI. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file system modifications are present. Pure knowledge-base skill.

content.user_title: Manage Stacked Pull Requests with Graphite CLI
content.value_statement: Managing complex code changes with multiple dependent pull requests is challenging. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for using the Graphite CLI to create, submit, and synchronize stacked diffs efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Create branches and commits with gt create command
Submit and update stacked pull requests with gt submit
Synchronize stacks with trunk using gt sync
Navigate between branches in a stack with gt up/down/top/bottom
Restructure stacks using gt move, gt fold, gt split
Resolve merge conflicts during restacking operations
limitations: Does not execute commands - provides guidance only
Requires Graphite CLI to be installed locally
GitHub integration required for PR creation

use_cases.title: Break down features
use_cases.description: Split large features into small, reviewable stacked PRs for faster feedback cycles

use_cases.title: Review incremental changes
use_cases.description: Understand dependency chains between changes and review small, focused diffs in isolation

use_cases.title: Coordinate workflows
use_cases.description: Manage complex multi-branch codebases and keep dependent branches synchronized with trunk

prompt_templates.title: Create a branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a new branch from main using Graphite CLI with all my current changes and a commit message

prompt_templates.title: Submit stack
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I submit an entire stack of branches to GitHub with reviewers in one command

prompt_templates.title: Sync changes
prompt_templates.prompt: What commands do I use to sync my stack with the latest changes from the main branch and resolve any conflicts

prompt_templates.title: Apply feedback
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use gt absorb to apply reviewer feedback across multiple branches in my stack at once

output_examples.input: I have reviewer feedback on my bottom branch that also applies to the branches above it. How do I apply these changes across my whole stack?
output: Use `gt absorb -a` to automatically distribute unstaged changes to the relevant downstack commits
Make your code edits to address the feedback
Run `gt absorb -a` to find and apply each change hunk to the appropriate commit
Run `gt submit` or `gt submit --stack` to push the updated stack
The skill will find the closest downstack commit that each change can be applied to deterministically

best_practices: Run `gt sync` frequently to keep your stack up-to-date with trunk and avoid large rebase conflicts
Keep each branch small and focused on a single logical change for faster, more thorough code reviews
Use `gt log short` regularly to visualize your stack structure and verify dependencies are correct
anti_patterns: Creating large monolithic PRs that combine multiple unrelated changes in a single branch
Manually rebasing branches instead of using Graphite's automated restacking commands
Working in isolation without syncing, leading to merge conflicts when submitting

faq.question: Does this skill work with GitLab or other Git hosting platforms?
faq.answer: No. Graphite CLI is designed specifically for GitHub and its pull request workflow.

faq.question: What are the limits on stack depth?
faq.answer: Graphite supports deep stacks but practical limits depend on repository size and merge complexity.

faq.question: How does Graphite integrate with existing git workflows?
faq.answer: Graphite wraps git commands. You can use standard git alongside Graphite for non-stack operations.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere when using Graphite?
faq.answer: No. Graphite operates locally. Only PR metadata is sent to GitHub for pull request creation.

faq.question: Why did gt sync fail with a merge conflict?
faq.answer: Conflict occurs when trunk changes overlap with your branch changes. Resolve manually then run gt continue.

faq.question: How is this different from git rebase?
faq.answer: Graphite automates rebasing across entire dependency chains and tracks branch relationships automatically.
